attributes.action: Stop all serving politicians from being included in any Honours lists
attributes.background: Time and time again who ever is in government are seen to be rewarding loyal members of their party even if they aren't doing a good job. Being Knighted for sitting on a committee or being a loyal party member isn't good enough and is making a joke of the whole system.

attributes.action: Send a force to free people that are being enslaved in Libya
attributes.background: Are we the generation to be remembered for allowing slavery back? People are being enslaved in Libya in broad daylight and the World knows. It is unacceptable that only lip service has been paid to such a violation of human life. We have been complicit in these evil acts by our failure to act.
attributes.additional_details:
Libya migrant 'slave market' footage sparks outrage - BBC News - http://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-42038451

https://www.google.co.uk/url?sa=t&source=web&rct=j&url=http://amp.timeinc.net/time/5042560/libya-slave-trade&ved=0ahUKEwi3-Zyv0ZbYAhVQ_KQKHZ7CAIgQFggkMAA&usg=AOvVaw1OKyfqviElPGxqFMjSAiJR&ampcf=1

attributes.action: Ban the testing of household cleaning product ingredients on animals.
attributes.background: There is no law in the UK that bans the testing of cleaning products on animals. This is a cruel practice with no practical use whatsoever. I urge you to please sign this petition if you , like me love animals and do not want to see them suffer.

attributes.action: Pressure video sharing sites to remove violent/graphic videos targeted at kids
attributes.background: The online safety of our kids is not being taken seriously by video sharing sites like YouTube. There are hundreds maybe thousands of videos being masked as our children's favourite cartoons. More needs to be done to remove this content before it is published!

attributes.action: Let the people decide whether Brexit included the single market & customs union
attributes.background: This petition requires the UK Governemnt to clarify by public vote before March 2018 whether the intention of referendum voters was to leave membership of the EU only, or also to leave the single market and customs union and related institutions as extrapolated by the UK Government.

attributes.action: Specialised glasses for the colour-blind on the NHS
attributes.background:
Imagine opening you eyes every morning and everything is browns yellows and dark blues.
Imagine growing up realising there's a whole new world of colours, yet your unable to see what others see. Reds, pinks, purples, oranges, light blues are some of the basic colours that a victim of Deuteranopia
attributes.additional_details:
My aim in this petitions is to try and fight to get glasses for the colour-blind available on the NHS. Why? 
•Children experiencing difficulty at school if colours are used to help with learning 
•Problems with food, such as identifying whether meat is fully cooked or whether fruit is ripe 
•Getting medications confused 
•Trouble identifying safety warnings or signs 
•Slightly limited career choices – certain jobs, such as pilots, train drivers and electricians

attributes.action: Scrap the Severn bridge tolls sooner than December 2018.
attributes.background: The Severn bridge tolls are due to be scrapped in December 2018, with a reduction in January 2018. The bridge has paid for itself several times over but the UK government refuse to abolish the tolls sooner, this is having a detrimental effect on the welsh economy, welsh business and commuters.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal,not civil, offence to take part in an unauthorised encampment
attributes.background: Many UK citizens are regularly subjected to anti-social behaviour by people who make camp in their neighbourhood whilst on their travels. Invariably when they move on they leave a considerable amount of mess and damage behind which costs the land owners a significant amount of money to address.
attributes.additional_details: On more than one occasion our local school have been required to pay many thousands of pounds to clean up the children's playing field after travellers had left. There was national outrage recently when travellers left 600 ton of rubbish in a field in Uxbridge. They were not even issued with a ticket for littering! Anyone taking part in an unauthorised encampment must be held legally responsible for leaving the site in the same state as they found it and also prosecuted in the courts.

attributes.action: Provide victims of the most severe sexual crimes anonymity throughout trial.
attributes.background: Currently victims of crimes under the Sexual Offences (Amendment) Act 1992 are given lifetime anonymity from the media. Despite attempts to fully provide protection during trial details of the victims name are made available to the accused; even in cases of serious sexual assault by a stranger.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition calls for other means of identifying victims such as pseudonym, case number or photo to be considered.
 
Sexual assaults are crimes of power and control, a name is a key part of personal identity so giving the accused the victim’s name adds to the assault. Much of what you do or are is linked to your name, having it makes it easy to identify, locate or contact someone.
 
Using a victim’s name within courts would seem to contravene Article 8 of the Human Rights Act.

attributes.action: Spend at least 60 billion pounds every year in Defense by 2020
attributes.background: We, as well as British and US military officials, ask that the UK government increases the armed forces defense budget so we are able to protect our country from states such as Russia and North Korea. We must stop cuts to our armed forces at this critical time, to counter the threats that face today
attributes.additional_details: https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/uk-41903960

attributes.action: Require all pubs and clubs to have metal detectors
attributes.background: By making it a legal requirement to have metal detectors at the entrances of pubs and clubs we could prevent people from even carrying a knife on a night out; fear of it being found and leading to a criminal offence of carrying a deadly weapon.
attributes.additional_details: The security staff on pubs and clubs are there to protect customers and adhere to rules and policies of the venue –how can they protect someone from a knife if they are unaware of someone entering with a weapon of such.

attributes.action: Make it that front number plates do not have to be shown on a motor vehicle
attributes.background: Make it so that on a motor vehicle that you don’t have to display a front number plate.

attributes.action: We want a public enquiry into whether children are needlessly taken into care
attributes.background: More and more children are being removed from families by social services. Applications to take children into care are at record levels. We need a public enquiry to look at why this is happening and whether children are being needlessly removed from their families.

attributes.action: Eliminate the use of black plastic in food packaging.
attributes.background:
Most recycling plants use optical sorting systems which cannot detect the black plastic against the conveyor belts. This means the packaging ends up as landfill or incinerator waste.
When manufacturers use recyclable plastic trays they should be forced to choose a colour suitable for recycling.
attributes.additional_details:
It is misleading for a manufacturer to label the black plastic as recyclable when our recycling plants cannot detect it. To eliminate its use will make recycling information clearer to the consumer. 
Using a different colour will substantially increase the amount of plastic packaging which can be recycled through our household waste collections.

http://www.wrap.org.uk/content/recyclability-black-plastic-packaging-0

attributes.action: Clearing pavements of ice should not bring legal liability if someone then falls
attributes.background: The law is such that persons clearing public pavements of snow and ice, e.g. outside their house or business, are then liable for civil action in the event someone slips, whereas not clearing the ice means you are not responsible, and thus can't be sued. The result is more dangerous pavements.
attributes.additional_details:
While the principle of "liability where actions have been taken" is sound, in this case it results in a less beneficial outcome. 
Government advice is "you're unlikely to be sued", but that is hardly encouraging. https://www.gov.uk/clear-snow-road-path-cycleway

There will always be a grey area where the use of inappropriate methods (like warm water) should be admissible when determining blame, but in the absence of such proof, the intent to clear ice in itself should not bring liability.

attributes.action: To grant 6yr old epilepsy sufferer Alfie Dingley a licence for medical cannabis.
attributes.background: The Home Office need to act to grant 6yr old epilepsy sufferer Alfie Dingley a licence for medical cannabis. He was treated with it in Holland and his seizures reduced from 150 to 1 seizure a month. Alfie should not have to break the law to access his medicine. He needs this medicine to live.
attributes.additional_details: Alfie is 1 of 9 of nine boys in the world who suffer from PCH19. Without this licence from the Home Office to use medicinal cannabis Alfie's seizures will return to over 150 a month each requiring hospitalisation. He will not have the quality of life he deserves. The only treatment he responds to in the UK causes psychosis, organ damage and early death. The family should not have to accept this. The licence should be granted, Alfie is a patient not a criminal. He needs access to his medicine.

attributes.action: Stop Government bTB tests being a death sentence on healthy animals.
attributes.background: Alpaca owners want the Government to work with them to eradicate bovine tuberculosis(btb). Testing rules are draconian and need to be reviewed. Please support a testing regime that does not condemn a healthy alpaca to death by always allowing a retest where no substantial evidence for disease exits.
attributes.additional_details:
At the moment less than 7% of alpacas have been tested and the industry wants that to be at least 80%. 

bTB test results are not being shared by APHA or collated and thus no opportunity exists to improve the current situation. Animals are unnecessarily culled before the data is captured. The situation will never improve unless we all work together to learn more about these unique animals for the benefit of all livestock keepers in the UK.

attributes.action: Change the law to make the sex offenders register public
attributes.background: Every few months we hear of another sex offender who’s been living in our area beside our kids and schools, our children are not safe to walk to school or play with friends because they keep them protected and not the people at real risk

attributes.action: Call upon the British Government to stop Northern Ireland MLAs pay.
attributes.background: Northern Ireland MLAs are still being paid after yet again no agreement. People that are not doing work should not be paid and we all know it will encourage a deal to be made.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of Angora rabbit fur products in the UK
attributes.background: Angora rabbit fur is often harvested from live rabbits. Their legs are stretched and pinned down while their fur is ripped out leaving them to scream helplessly in pain. Its an inhumane and cruel practice that we must make a stand against.
attributes.additional_details: Britain should make a stand against and the Angora fur trade to demonstrate cruelly harvested products are not tolerated. The unethical practice of removal of rabbit fur in China has recently been highlighted by People for the Unethical Treatment of Animals (PETA.) Their graphic evidence is featured on their website. The rabbits are kept in disgusting conditions and subjected to abuse that is beyond words.

attributes.action: Freedom of Information Act should apply to any company working for the Govt.
attributes.background: There are many Private sector companies that have accepted a contract from either Local or Central Government. They are receiving tax payers money, yet are providing no transparency to the public. Its time for these companies to be included in the the current FOI.

attributes.action: Pass a law requiring cattle allowed to graze grass outside min. 8 hours per day
attributes.background: Many dairy cattle are kept in sheds for up to 24 hours a day, in some cases all year. They're fed diets which aren't healthy or natural for them. As a result of this, over-milking and preventing movement they typically become ill and are killed at 3 to 5 years old. Their natural lifespan is 20 years
attributes.additional_details:
Scientific studies & other information
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/17033013
https://stud.epsilon.slu.se/5285/1/kivling_s_130215.pdf
https://www.ciwf.org.uk/farm-animals/cows/dairy-cows
https://www.ciwf.org.uk/media/5235185/the-life-of-dairy-cows.pdf
http://www.research.ed.ac.uk/portal/en/publications/housing-system-milk-production-and-zerograzing-effects-on-lameness-and-leg-injury-in-dairy-cows(117d66b0-cd77-4c79-82f6-d15053cd02fb).html

attributes.action: Abolish workplace parking charges for NHS staff
attributes.background: These people dedicate their lives to helping the sick and vulnerable and are often poorly paid . It seems extremely unfair that they should be charged for attending work.

attributes.action: Release the 2012 NHS reform risk Assessment.
attributes.background: In 2012, the Health Secretary vetoed the publication of the risk assessment relating to the changes introduced in the Health and Social Care Act. The Information Commissioner's office declared that in the circumstances this was unreasonable and requested they be released.
attributes.additional_details: This petition requests that said document is released in the name of transparency.  No law was implemented to allow the government to pursue its current restructuring of the NHS and a reorganisation was guaranteed to be "off the cards" by the prime minister.  The current government has no mandate to reorganise the NHS and create ACOs.  We request access to the risk assessment in order to see if this was predicted prior to the 2012 HaSCA and whether the current collapse of the NHS was preventable

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for all cyclists to wear reflective jackets in the dark.
attributes.background: I frequently drive in the dark during the Autumn/Winter months and have noticed how frequently I pass cyclists that are not wearing anything reflective. To ensure the safety of cyclists and of drivers, I feel that it should be compulsory for them to wear a reflective jacket in the dark.
attributes.additional_details: Most of the cyclists I pass in the Autumn/Winter months wear dark clothing and rely on a small bicycle light to make them noticeable to drivers. It is not safe and it is not helpful. I feel that these cyclists are putting their own lives at risk by not wearing reflective clothing and by not doing so, also putting drivers at risk. I feel quite strongly about this, mostly because the reflective jackets are not expensive, so there is no excuse not to wear one.

attributes.action: Government facilitate a cross party group of MP’s to assess the needs of the NHS
attributes.background: Suggest political parties stop using the problems the NHS faces for political gain and to work together to improve it for patients and employees of the service. To co-operate with each other to find the best solutions to maintaining a sustainable high level of health care for everyone.
attributes.additional_details:
The group could analyse other successful health care schemes, their procedures, expenditure measured against results. Do hospital and GP procedures need to change?

Is the British health care system working so well that it only needs more funds? If so, how can further funds be raised without increasing the national debt? All of these questions will be more credible to all political parties if answered by a cross party group of MP’s.

attributes.action: Ban plastic toys from restaurant kids meals
attributes.background: As part of a concerted effort to reduce plastic consumption, we should tackle the easy target of removing the toys given as part of happy meals from restaurants such as McDonald's and Burger King. These toys could easily be replaced with something more educational and environmentally friendly.

attributes.action: To make it law that all public places to have a defibrillator on site
attributes.background: On the 23rd a December I was at a non league football match, a spectator suffered a cardiac arrest. The club had a defibrillator on site and that saved the mans life.
attributes.additional_details: I was going make the petition about non league football grounds having a defibrillator, I have decided to make it all public places. For example every supermarket , football ground and shopping centre must have a defibrillator.

attributes.action: Provide increase support for parents with disabilities and their children
attributes.background: Children who have parents with disabilities are only able to access free school meals, the nursery grant for 2 year olds and pupil premium if they are on income related benefits. This means many working parents with a disabled partner are left better off leaving work to care for their families.
attributes.additional_details: Where a parent is on PIP they are considered “incapacitated” for childcare purposes in tax credit legislation and for extended hours nursery provision for 3 year olds. This does not extend to pupil premium, 2 year old nursery places or to free school meals - even if the incapacitated parent is unable to prepare a meal for themselves. Where one parent works and the other is considered incapacitated, children should receive these in order for the working parent to remain in work.

attributes.action: Lower Import duty on classic car parts from the USA.
attributes.background: Many small car/garage businesses in the UK rely on classic car parts and associated services from the USA but many struggle financially  due to the amount of duty paid. We ask Parliament to either abolish it on classic car parts or lower it to a reasonable level, with clear rules on its application
attributes.additional_details: There have been numberous instances where we have sent car parts for engineering work in the USA having already imported it from the USA only to be charged import duty again on the parts return to the UK. The rules are evidently either unfair or unclear to those applying them. Your urgent attention to this matter would be greatly appreciated.

attributes.action: Save Old Heath Saxon Church, Chesterfield, Derbyshire.
attributes.background: Old Heath Saxon Church mentioned in the Doomsday Book is going to be demolished for HS2 ROUTE. Save our Saxon history, we wouldn't knock down Stonehenge or other historic structures. Please don't let this happen.
attributes.additional_details: HS2 proposed route

attributes.action: Make Financial Studies a core subject on the National Curriculum at Key Stage 4
attributes.background: Sometimes we all question some of the things we had to learn at school, like pi or algebra, and how they have had no relevance in our lives at all. Some of us may have achieved an A* in our English Literature exam, but Shakespeare will never help you understand how to get a mortgage or manage debt.
attributes.additional_details: Debt and money issues are a rising concern for young people in the UK, with those aged 16 to 24 having the highest individual debt to income ratio amongst all over age groups (Household debt inequalities dataset, ONS, April 2016). School should be preparing our children for the real world, and I call on the UK Government to make financial studies a core subject in our National Curriculum, so that our children can leave school with the best chances of being financially stable and debt free.

attributes.action: Ban log burning stoves that pollute the air
attributes.background: Myself and my disabled husband cannot use our garden nor go out our door without smoke and smell on our clothes and air. Smoke and smell come into the house if we open a window or door.
attributes.additional_details: Have reported this to fire services, who saw it and gave us masks to wear to get to church. Carers have witnessed the debris and smoke. Environmental health officer saw it and debris and did nothing but said he should have collected the debris.

attributes.action: Make rail strikes illegal
attributes.background: Rail strikes cause misery to millions of commuters and also have a negative impact on the economy. Taxpayers subsidise train delays too. Make train strikes illegal. Railway employees should be open to the modernisation of the railways which ultimately benefits all.

attributes.action: Make teaching about tax and local politics compulsory in secondary schools.
attributes.background: Many people when they leave secondary school and college are thrown into the deep end of life and know nothing about the world they are entering into causing them to end up in debt or not even know how to pay bills.

attributes.action: Increase school funding in Hackney schools back to what it was.
attributes.background: Schools in Hackney are now really struggling in buying new resources especially that the new GCSE, A-Level and BTEC curriculum has been introduced. Schools need the resources, and they aren’t able to fund them.

attributes.action: Increase the student loan repayment threshold for all graduates (Type 1 Loan)
attributes.background: Type 2 (Post sep 2012 students) student loans have recently had a threshold increase to £25000. Now pre Sep 2012 starters pay 9% contributions on every single penny above £17,775. If a grad from 2014 and 15 both earned 25k. Then the grad from 2014 would earn (Gross) £650.25 less than the 2015 grad.
attributes.additional_details:
This could be the difference between being approved for a mortgage or refused. 

Considering only the top 23% of graduates pay their loans back within 30 years. We want the government to help all graduates and make the threshold for all student loans the same. 

It could be suggested its just another kick in the teeth for millennials who were born a decade late for affordable housing. 

https://www.moneysavingexpert.com/news/family/2017/10/victory-for-graduates-student-loan-repayment-threshold

attributes.action: Mandate display of plastic:food volume ratio on all packaged foods items.
attributes.background:
More than 8 million tonnes of plastic reaches our oceans each year. 
By providing consumers with a plastic:food ratio on all packaging (with an associated red, amber or green rating) we will give them the facts to enable them to accept or reject products based on their impact on our environment.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Department of Health's colour coded front-of-pack scheme was introduced in 2009 and gives consumers the nutritional info they need to make the best choices for their health. Research into similar schemes has shown that sales of green items increased by 5% and sales of red items decreased by 9%.

Showing the ratio of plastic packaging:food volume empowers consumers to make the best choice for the health of our oceans. Let consumer power change the way global food corporations package.

attributes.action: Ban balloons for marketing/business use  immediately.
attributes.background: Balloons used for marketing  often have ribbon tied to them.This is a fatal combination for wildlife.The balloon chokes and the string wraps around the wildlife, killing or maiming.There are better alternatives, like plastic free bunting.Children would not want the balloon if they knew it could kill
attributes.additional_details:
https://balloonsblow.org
http://www.onegreenplanet.org/animalsandnature/balloon-releases-are-killing-animals/
https://www.rspca.org.uk/adviceandwelfare/litter
http://m.worldanimalfoundation.org/articles/article/8948431/182504.htm
https://www.wur.nl/en/article/4.-How-many-animals-die-because-of-balloons.htm
https://www.peta.org/blog/balloon-releases-littering-and-killing-animals/
https://www.fws.gov/news/blog/index.cfm/2015/8/5/Balloons-and-Wildlife-Please-Dont-Release-Your-Balloons

attributes.action: Bring back the convalescent homes in the UK
attributes.background: The A&E departments are oversubscribed because there are insufficient beds in the hospital's due to the lack of care providers for discharged patients . This deficit in care provision is because the care sector is underpaid especially because of pay and conditions. We need convalescent homes back.
attributes.additional_details: The rural areas have a lack of home care provision brought about by low wage levels and pay conditions which deny payments for travel time and mileage. This means that the rural areas are not easily served. Hence these care providers have a high turnover of staff. For the majority of single elderly, a return home after major surgery is one with no care. Convalescent homes would allow a low level of staffing serving more patients.  Benefits to patients is safety, peer competition & high morale.

attributes.action: Establish 14th March as a public holiday
attributes.background: On the passing of Stephen Hawking establish a day on which to honour him and all the nation's mathematicians and scientists (eg Newton, Halley, Babbage, Lovelace, Somerville, Berners-Lee etc etc); to fall within UK Science Week; coinciding with Pi Day. .
attributes.additional_details: A public holiday to be observed on the 14th March, a day given to discussion, deliberation, display and development of science and to encourage involvement and understanding by all

attributes.action: Government to fund a scheme for carers flying with a person with disabilities
attributes.background: I’m asking the government to look into possible concessions for carers who have to fly with disabled people,I understand it’s not a governmental problem it’s in it’s a commercial problem but surely there is something you can do
attributes.additional_details: These concessions are desperately needed for example  I flew to Australia in 2005 and because I’m 6’5 I’m unable to fly economy so I’m forced to fly business or first class, on this occasion I paid for first class seats but I had to provide a equal seat for my carer and the total cost for the flight was £13,000 surely you can see this is totally disgusting.  Just because I’m disabled that doesn’t mean I shouldn’t be able to go on holiday when I want

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to purposely waste ambulance time & resources.
attributes.background:
Recently an ambulance service rushed to attend to a man claiming to have had a stroke, only to find out he made it up so he could get a free lift. 

Unfortunately the service has said it has to deal with ‘day in day out’ and that unfortunately there is no law against wasting ambulance time.

attributes.action: Reinstate AS levels for sixth form students (aged 16-18) in the UK
attributes.background: As of 2015, the AS level (examined in Year 1 &2)  has been removed in place of a ‘linear Alevel’ structure (examined Y2)  - How are students expected to retain all 2 years worth of content whilst completing UCAS, working, doing extra curricular activities and maintaining their mental health ?
attributes.additional_details: https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.tes.com/news/school-news/breaking-news/pupils-exam-stress-rising-dramatically-new-figures-show%3famp

attributes.action: Scrap the points on speeding offences
attributes.background:
Government should scrap the points for speeding offences only keep fines if any one is speeding they should get fine no points 
This government should scrap the points on speeding offences

attributes.action: Include teaching on online safety to children in all Primary & Secondary schools
attributes.background: Children and young people are increasingly vulnerable to online bullying, abuse and exploitation, as well as serious crime networks.This needs to be acknowledged in schools, and children need to be empowered to better protect themselves and their peers from online abuse.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to impregnate dairy cows sooner than 2 years after giving birth
attributes.background: Dairy cattle are typically artificially inseminated every year to keep them pregnant or lactating. This, poor diet, selective breeding for milk yield, and preventing them moving, contribute to diseases and them being killed at usually 2 to 5 years old. Cows' natural lifespan is around 20 years.
attributes.additional_details: Scientific studies & other information https://www.ciwf.org.uk/farm-animals/cows/dairy-cows/ https://www.ciwf.org.uk/media/5235188/Welfare-sheet-Dairy-cows.pdf https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/16958626 https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2851724/

attributes.action: Protect workers while in their Probationary period within an employment contract
attributes.background:
Currently the employment law does not protect employees during the probationary period of a new contract. 
An employer can dismiss the member of staff without reason within this period with no review and the employee has no legal right to challenge it. 
I feel this needs to change.
attributes.additional_details:
The Government needs to protect employees by making sure that a review meeting, through the period should be carried out allowing time to improve. 
Also if at the end of the probationary period the employer feels the employee is not suitable then a reason must be given following guidelines. 
The government should make it illegal to dismiss anyone without given support to improve or a reason why they are being dismissed. 
This is currently allowed to happen giving workers no protection

attributes.action: Have a meaningful vote on Parliamentary Petitions after a debate
attributes.background: Currently petitions from this website have no legislative effect, they are merely debated and then left in the dust. To be a more transparent democracy this should be changed such that these public parliamentary petitions may be formed into motions and potentially into law.
attributes.additional_details:
In my eyes an ideal system would be to have these petitions firstly carry on as they are; proceeding to go to debate if they hit 100,000 signatories, have the non-binding debate in parliament as is at the moment and THEN, after that debate, have all present Commons MPs vote on forming the petition into an official parliamentary motion that is then brought to the Commons Chamber.

This will create for a more direct and transparent democracy which I would hope for the government to support.

attributes.action: Allow more people of non British Nationality/Citizenship join the British Army
attributes.background: I am not of British decent my dream would be to join the British Army as I have been living here in Scotland for 11 years and want to serve what i class as my country right now members of the Commonwealth and with British Citizenship can serve So me being Polish makes joining a real issue, Thanks.
attributes.additional_details: The last calls for Polish Citizens to be allowed to join the Forces was in 2008 but nothing came from so when i found out about this when i was doing me research I was really disappointed so i applied for a Citizenship but that also got knocked back making my dreams feel impossible to achieve so i would like peoples help in making my dreams come true and i'm sure many other people are having the same issue as me they love the country the live in but are not allowed to serve in its Armed Forces
